page.title: 13HEATH V.A. SCHOOL
page.content:
Great concern arose in the area in 1983 when Heath V.A.(Voluntary Aided) school was proposed for closure.
Of some 28,000 schools in England and Wales, nearly one third are voluntary aided by groups, mainly religious.
Heath school, founded in last Century is one of some 5,000 belonging to the Church of England.
Suggestions that it might have to close, due to falling numbers of pupils and difficulties with the old buildings caused many protests.
The school future now looks more secure. Many rural schools have been closed and the decline in the birth rate means that many schools built in the 1950s are likely to close.
